pros:
Mission, Vision and Values are integral to everything we do
Clear organisational strategy
Investment for staff development
Staff Benefits
Office location
Hybrid Working
cons: As an organisation we have delivered an ambitious programme to improve child health and as a consequence workload remains high... a victim of our own success.

review_title: Most of the directors are out of their depth
pros: Great bunch of people working there - some very skilled and dedicated people among the staff and also among the clinicians associated with the College. Interesting work. Nice bit of town.
cons: Many of the directors have little regard for staff, paediatricians, paediatrics or even children. Sluggish thinking and very little ability to react to changing situations. More interested in treading water while looking out for their next over-paid role. Just don't seem very interested in the job.

review_title: Great but started to lose it's shine
pros: - Good career development opportunities. - Employer that invests in its employees - particularly those who are starting out in the field or beginning work for the first time. - Generally a good and happy place to work especially when I started. - Compassionate HR team with a forward thinking leader although some key members have now left. - Made good moves to become more professional and cut glaring disparities between similar jobs in different departments - Strong focus on equality and diversity. - On the whole a good work life balance.
cons: - Workload could be relentless and the College was not able to properly resource some teams. - Was a very warm, friendly employer when I started but it felt a lot colder by the time I left with some of the nice to haves cut. Felt like penny pinching and hit what had been a warm, committed culture of staff towards the College. - Aggressive Trade Union who don't speak for the vast majority of staff but would whip up negative feelings and drag down morale.

pros: Location, training for junior staff is excellent for admin organisational posts. Clinicians are great, acting as line managers.
cons:
Training for research and academia limited.
Ditto other comments on senior management. who are over paid and need to support more. Not leave to line managers. Look down more not just up.  Needs to be more flexible and responsive to national health issues. Big focus on media but little impact. Actual research non existent.  Too many organisational managers just pushing paper up and down the line. Some have no actual experience or worse knowledge of what their position entails and that is considered acceptable. Too many directors for such a small organisation. Specialism not valued. 

Restructure and COVID poorly handled. Staff went above and beyond especially IT, with no reward. In fact leave length reduced.

job_title: Quality Assurance Project Manager in London, England
pros: Great developmental opportunities and support. Ample amount of training and learning courses. The college is always keen to retain talent within the organisation - good promotion and progression.
cons: Significant responsibilities and less pay! Lack of internal communication between divisions.

pros: Interesting work, autonomy and freedom to carry out work and great clinicians to work with
cons: HR department I'll equipped to deal with staff mental health and poor performance issues. Senior management too focused on profit rather than delivering quality, and leads to burn out from staff who are committed to the values of the organisation.

review_title: Good Company - Has some minor issues
pros: Has helped me develop in many ways and they have a super friendly environment.
cons:
Contacting people for important Information can become a hassle at times which can lead to some people getting frustrated.

I have noticed some signs of toxicity settling in, very minor although has made me concerned.

pros: Very nice people, decent office, manageable work load.
cons: Lots of competing priorities which can be difficult to manage.

review_title: Needs to move into the 21st century
pros: Development oppportunities are ok with inhouse training provided
cons: SMT are a bunch of boomers who need to move woth the times, some old rules and regulations exist - little flexible working, dress policy, college has tick box attitude but does not care about staff

pros: Great management but help up the ladder needs pushing
HR will advise and help you to achieve your career aspirations
cons: Always very busy so you need to be able to multitask

pros:
Lovely offices and centrally located in London.  The staff there are extremely friendly and welcoming and all have a passion about working for the benefits of the cause.  I have never worked with such a good team before.  

HR are very supportive and are always striving to find ways to help staff feel engaged and motivated resulting in more and more staff rewards.

There were always opportunities for development and plenty of quality training was delivered in house.

Overall the organisation is very professional and forward thinking
cons: It was sometimes difficult to manage demands from stakeholders and to know where the priorities were.  Other than that it was the best place I've worked and I would totally recommend others working there.

pros:
The people are really friendly.  The work is focused on improving the healthcare of children.  The opportunities for professional development are vast as the training provided is excellent and broad.

The CEO is outstanding and really knows the staff as well as understands the complexity of the health service.
cons: None other than being a small organization it means that one has to leave to progress after reaching a certain grade.

pros: It has a good working environment and the management is very approachable. The salary is also very good.
cons: There is a preferential treatment of some people that want to advance in their careers in detriment of others. Not everybody is given the same opportunities to evolve. Many colleagues and myself felt that management and HR were bending the rules on some occasions to fit their favourite candidate.

pros: Good salary, offers lots of traning for staff and professional development
cons: Small organisation therefore difficult to work your way up, each division is quite divided and even within divisions quite clique. Quite a separation amongst grades Can be off putting for a new starter

pros: Overall mission and work being carried out is inspiring and generally the people are great to work with.
